Wed., Nov. 8: A discussion on how "free speech" is essential to keeping power in check.
  


Speaking Truth to Power

Wednesday, November 8, 7 p.m.
Indianapolis Museum of Art
The Toby
4000 Michigan Rd
Indianapolis, IN 46208

RSVP TODAY
Share this:           

Now more than ever, democracy demands we understand our rights and responsibilities regarding free speech.

As defenders of the First Amendment, the ACLU's free speech position often leads us to defend the rights of all different people, expressing different opinions. When does expression, including music, poetry, and visual art, warrant defense, even if they are offensive to some? When does language become a tool of oppression, the defense of which is unjustifiable to many?

Join us on Wednesday, November 8 for a discussion of all the fun stuff – sex, religion, and art – and how "free speech" is essential to keeping power in check, but isn't easy and certainly isn't free of costs, to speaker or listener.

This discussion features Lee Rowland, a senior staff attorney with the national ACLU Speech, Privacy, and Technology Project; Tamara Winfrey Harris, an Indianapolis author who writes about the intersection of pop culture with race and gender; and Tatjana Rebelle, activist and founder of the longest running spoken word show in Indianapolis.

Walk-ins are welcome, but due to limited seating, we ask that you RSVP by noon on Wednesday, November 8. Questions? Contact us at info@aclu-in.org.
